str2: Joseph, a proper name. Of Hebrew origin; Joseph, the name of seven Israelites.
From Leui; a Levite, i.e. Descendant of Levi.
A Cypriote, belonging to Cyprus. From Kupros; a Cyprian, i.e. Inhabitant of Cyprus.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.

str2: (a) To call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: To call upon, appeal to, address.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To translate (from one language into another), interpret. From meta and hermeneuo; to explain over, i.e. Translate.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
